description: This unit develops critical understandings of key concepts and issues in sustainability, education for sustainability, and sustainable development. It adopts a place-responsive approach to developing understandings of sustainability and sustainable practices, including management strategies for specific outdoor environments that variously attempt to conserve, preserve, prevent, change or balance particular interactions and uses. The unit draws on the lenses of outdoor education, experiential education and environmental education, and considers their contributions to 'eco pedagogy'. Topics draw on investigations of creative and critical teaching and learning about culture--nature concepts and relationships, complemented by local field and professional examples to develop practices and capabilities for designing and assessing a range of 'eco pedagogies'.
